DataElement.preferredName: DART Currently Lacks Appetite Score 11 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation of their current lack of appetite, using an 11 point visual analogue scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Distress Assessment and Response Tool Current Lacks Appetite Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A short, self-assessment to measure an individual's physical symptoms, emotional burden and practical concerns that could interfere with their ability to engage in cancer treatment._Occurring in or belonging to the present time._A question about whether an individual lacks or lacked an appetite._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A short, self-assessment to measure an individual's physical symptoms, emotional burden and practical concerns that could interfere with their ability to engage in cancer treatment.

Concepts.definition: A short, self-assessment to measure an individual's physical symptoms, emotional burden and practical concerns that could interfere with their ability to engage in cancer treatment.

ValueDomain.preferredName: DART Lack of Appetite 11 Point Scale
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A short, self-assessment to measure an individual's physical symptoms, emotional burden and practical concerns that could interfere with their ability to engage in cancer treatment._A lack of appetite scale from 0 to 10 on which the patient marks the current level of lack of appetite experienced._An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

Concepts.definition: A subjective score of 0 on an appetite scale that ranges from 0: No Lack of Appetite to 10: Worst Possible Lack of Appetite.
